com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.utils

Class DebugUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.utils.DebugUtil

  • public class DebugUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains utilities to debug code, such as logging objects

      • randomizeBlock

        public static void randomizeBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Applies a random material to a block that does not equal the current material
        Materials that are used: STONE, DIRT, GRASS, WOOD, LOG, IRON_ORE, IRON_BLOCK, GOLD_BLOCK, DIAMOND_BLOCK
        Parameters:
        block - to randomize

                                  org.bukkit.Material... materials)

        Parameters:
        block - to randomize
        materials - to pick from

      • formatBlock

        public static java.lang.String formatBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block block)
        Formats all the properties of a block to a String. Uses format:
        #world [#x, #y, #z] #type
        Parameters:
        block - to format
        Returns:
        Formatted String

      • formatBlock

        public static java.lang.String formatBlock(org.bukkit.block.Block block,
                                           java.lang.String format)
        Formats all the properties of a block to a String
        #x = Block X
        #y = Block Y
        #z = Block Z
        #world = World name
        #typeid = Block Type Id
        #type = Block Type
        Parameters:
        block - to format
        format - to use
        Returns:
        Formatted String

      • heartbeat

        public static void heartbeat()
        Broadcasts HEARTBEAT with the current time
        Can be used to check if a ticked object is still alive

      • getVectorValue

        public static org.bukkit.util.Vector getVectorValue(java.lang.String name,
                                                    org.bukkit.util.Vector value)
        Gets the value of a Vector debug variable that can be changed using the /debug command. The x/y/z values can be specified after name. If name is 'test', then 'testx', 'testy' and 'testz' are added as debug variables.
        Parameters:
        name - of the value
        value - default
        Returns:
        value of the variable

      • getPluginCauses

        public static java.lang.String getPluginCauses()
        Looks at the current stack trace to find all potential plugins that could have caused something
        Returns:
        plugin causes

      • logInstances

        public static void logInstances(java.lang.Object value)
        Goes down the entirety of the server to see where a particular instance of a variable is referenced. Note that this is very, very slow! It is here to verify correct replacement of hooks and the like.

        All locations where the instance lives will be logged.
        Parameters:
        value - to find

      • logInstances

        public static void logInstances(java.lang.Class<?> startClass,
                                java.lang.Object value)
        Goes down the entirety of the class type specified to see where a particular instance of a variable is referenced. Note that this is very, very slow! It is here to verify correct replacement of hooks and the like.

        All locations where the instance lives will be logged.
        Parameters:
        startClass - to start looking for static values to begin
        value - to find
